00025 // modified by yuanlin jiang for handle pointers;
00026 
00027 //
00028 //      mv_vector_ptr.h       Basic vector class (ptr precision)
00029 //
00030 
00031 #ifndef _MV_VECTOR_ptr_H
00032 #define _MV_VECTOR_ptr_H    
00033 
00034 
00035 
00036 #include <cstdlib>
00037 #include <iostream>       // for formatted printing of matrices
00038 
00039 
00040 #ifdef MV_VECTOR_BOUNDS_CHECK
00041 #include <cassert>
00042 #endif
00043 
00044 #include "mvvind.h"
00045 
00046 // this is really used as a sort of global constant. The reason
00047 // for creating its own type is that so it can be overloaded to perform
00048 // a deep or shallow assignement.  (Any variable of type MV_Vector_::ref_type
00049 // has only one possible value: one.)
00050 //   It is included as a seperate file to avoid multiple definitions.
00051 
00052 #include "mvvrf.h"
00053 
00054 using namespace std;
00055 
00056 class MV_Vector_ptr
00057 {                                                                      
00058     protected:                                                           
00059            double **p_;
00060            unsigned int dim_;
00061            int ref_;  // 0 or 1; does this own its own memory space?
00062     public:                                                            
00063 
00064 
00065         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                                 
00066         /* Constructors/Destructors */                                 
00067         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                                 
00068                                                                        
00069     MV_Vector_ptr();                                            //pass
00070     MV_Vector_ptr(unsigned int);                        //pass           
00071         MV_Vector_ptr(unsigned int, const double*&);    //pass                                                     
00072                                                     
00073         MV_Vector_ptr(double**, unsigned int);      //pass
00074         MV_Vector_ptr(const double**, unsigned int);     //pass   
00075     MV_Vector_ptr(const MV_Vector_ptr &);       //pass
00076     
00077     // reference of an exisiting data structure
00078     //
00079     // note that ref() is initalized with i rather than 1.
00080     // this is so compilers will not generate a warning that i was
00081     // not used in the construction.  (MV_Vector::ref_type is an enum that
00082     // can *only* have the value of 1.
00083     //
00084     MV_Vector_ptr(double** d, unsigned int N, MV_Vector_::ref_type i) :
00085                             p_(d), dim_(N), ref_(i) {}
00086 
00087     MV_Vector_ptr(const MV_Vector_ptr &V, MV_Vector_::ref_type i)   :
00088                             p_(V.p_), dim_(V.dim_), ref_(i) {}
00089 
00090     ~MV_Vector_ptr();                              
00091                                                                        
00092         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                           
00093         /*  Indices and access operations */                           
00094         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                           
00095                                                                        
00096 
00097     double* &      operator()(unsigned int i)
00098                   {
00099 #                   ifdef MV_VECTOR_BOUNDS_CHECK
00100                     assert(i < dim_);
00101 #                   endif
00102                     return p_[i];
00103                   }
00104     double* & operator()(unsigned int i) const 
00105                   {
00106 #                   ifdef MV_VECTOR_BOUNDS_CHECK
00107                     assert(i < dim_);
00108 #                   endif
00109                     return p_[i];
00110                   }
00111 
00112     double* &      operator[](unsigned int i)
00113                   {
00114 #                   ifdef MV_VECTOR_BOUNDS_CHECK
00115                     assert(i < dim_);
00116 #                   endif
00117                     return p_[i];
00118                   }
00119     double* &       operator[](unsigned int i) const 
00120                   {
00121 #                   ifdef MV_VECTOR_BOUNDS_CHECK
00122                     assert(i < dim_);
00123 #                   endif
00124                     return p_[i];
00125                   }
00126 
00127 
00128     MV_Vector_ptr operator()(const MV_VecIndex &I) ;
00129     MV_Vector_ptr operator()(void);     //pass
00130     const MV_Vector_ptr operator()(void) const; //pass
00131 //  const MV_Vector_ptr operator()(const MV_VecIndex &I) const;
00132 
00133     inline unsigned int             size() const { return dim_;}
00134     inline unsigned int             dim() const { return dim_;}
00135     inline int                      ref() const { return  ref_;}
00136     inline int                      null() const {return dim_== 0;}
00137         
00138         //
00139         // Create a new *uninitalized* vector of size N
00140         MV_Vector_ptr & newsize(unsigned int );         //pass
00141                                                                        
00142         /*::::::::::::::*/                                             
00143         /*  Assignment  */                                             
00144         /*::::::::::::::*/                                             
00145                                                                        
00146     MV_Vector_ptr & operator=(const MV_Vector_ptr &);   //pass
00147 //    MV_Vector_ptr & operator=(const int&);
00148 
00149 
00150     friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &s, const MV_Vector_ptr &A);
00151 
00152 };
